titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 36: Badīʻ al-ḥisāb.

availability.licence: These images and the content of Rare Book and Manuscript Library MS Or 36: Badīʻ al-ḥisāb. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

notesStmt.note: Inserted: A letter written by David Eugene Smith on behalf of the American Mathematical Society (founded 1888) asking for contributions to the library of the Society laid in (between f. 5v and 6r). The back of the letter holds a handwritten long division problem, copied from f. 5v, with an explanation by Smith.

msContents.summary: Manual of arithmetic and geometry for merchants' use including how to calculate the area of a ship. According to the compiler, the work includes excerpts from the following texts: Muntakhab al-ḥisāb, Līlāvatī, and Dastūr al-ʻamal.

supportDesc.extent: [1], 76, [2] foliated leaves : 258 x 172 (185 x 90) mm, bound to 263 x 176 mm

layoutDesc.layout: 15 long lines with some geometrical figures and formulas written vertically in between the text.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in rapid nastaʻliq in black ink; pointed, unvocalized.

decoDesc.decoNote: Overlines, headings, and textual divisions in red. Geometrical diagrams in black.

binding.p: Islamic binding. Full brown leather with blind tooling.

origin.p: Copy completed on 25 April 1851; the corresponding date in Vikram Samvat, 1908, is also given (f. 76v).
